message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.DL. 

The paper deals with automatic short answer grading using machine learning techniques, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML). The paper proposes an iterative transfer learning-based ensemble technique, which involves the use of text classifiers and similarity measures, indicating the use of ML techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with NLP and ML. The paper also involves the use of transfer learning, which is a popular technique in deep learning (DL) and artificial intelligence (AI), indicating the possibility of the paper belonging to cs.LG (Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-categories. The paper also involves the use of similarity measures, which is a common technique in information retrieval (IR), indicating the possibility of the paper belonging to cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the use of canonical correlation analysis, which is a statistical technique used in ML, indicating the possibility of the paper belonging to cs.DL (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category.
